content.description: GOOD CLIMBING IN FINGERS CORNER WITH SOME FACE FEATURES AND SANDY, SLIGHTLY RUN OUT TOP TO ANCHORS
content.location: STARTING OFF STACKED BLOCKS (COULD BE KNOCKED DOWN)

climbs.name: LK & KC
climbs.fa: LAYTON KOR & KYLE COPELAND (DUE TO NAME?)

content.description: SUSTAINED CLIMBING ON P1 & P2. P1 IS GOOD, TWO STARTS. OFFWIDTH MOVES OF THE DECK OR A SEMI-TECHNICAL MOVE INTO A HAND CRACK. P2 FOLLOWS WIDE HANDS AND OFFWIDTH IN CORNER. DIRTY AND SLIGHTLY OVERGROWN NEAR TOP OF PITCH. P3 IS RUNOUT AND LOW ANGLE APX 5.5 CLIMBING. THERE ARE NO ANCHORS AT P2 SO IF YOU DECIDE TO CLIMB TO THIS POINT YOU WILL HAVE TO DO THE MANDATORY WALK OFF THE BACKSIDE OF THE BENCH TOWARDS THE CORONA ARCH TRAIL FOLLOWING THE BENCH.
content.protection: BOLTED ANCHORS AT P1 & P3. GOOD GEAR MOST WAY UP.  (.4-6 CAMALOT, DOUBLES ON BIG HANDS FOR P2)
content.location: LEFT MOST CRACK BEFORE BELAY LEDGE DROPS OFF.

content.description: GOOD CLIMBING IN A LEFT FACING CORNER, SOME STEMMING TO A LARGE FLAKE AND AROUND IT VIA LAYBACKING (EASIER) OR CLIMB IT IN TRUE OFFWIDTH STYLE (HARDER) WHILE PLACING GEAR.
content.protection: GOOD GEAR AND BOLTED ANCHORS, (.4 TO 4, OPTIONAL 5 FOR FLAKE BUT 4'S WILL DO)
